feed.title: This Strange World
feed.subtitle: The world is a strange place. From creepy conspiracy theories, to weird laws, to terrifying cults, this podcast explores them all. Each week, one of our hosts takes a deep dive into a strange, weird, and random topic, and discusses what they found with the other hosts.

author.name: Gavin Berger, Leah Ettinger, and Chris Ashe

entry.title: 2020 Year in Review - Season 1 Episode 27
entry.content:
For our final episode of the year and the season, we decided to do a 2020 Year in Review! We start by looking back on some of the most popular trends and topics from this past year, and then we delve into some of the biggest topics in Music, Sports, Movies, and TV. (Hint: 2020 was quite the year.)

Sources

https://trends.google.com/trends/yis/2020/US/
https://www.news24.com/channel/music/news/documentaries-about-music-stars-were-all-the-rage-in-2020-here-are-5-to-watch-20201224-2
https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/the-official-top-40-biggest-songs-of-2020-so-far__29264/
https://www.wonderwall.com/entertainment/music/biggest-music-moments-of-2020-so-far-356120.gallery?photoId=394638
https://www.latimes.com/sports/story/2020-12-22/timeline-biggest-events-moments-sports-2020
https://reelgood.com/year/2020

author.name: Gavin Berger, Leah Ettinger, and Chris Ashe

entry.summary: For our final episode of the year and the season, we decided to do a 2020 Year in Review! We start by looking back on some of the most popular trends and topics from this past year, and then we delve into some of the biggest topics in Music, Sports, Movies, and TV. (Hint: 2020 was quite the year.)

entry.title: Unique Holiday Traditions - Season 1 Episode 26
entry.content:
For this holiday episode, Leah takes us through some unique holiday traditions, talking about food, festivities, and decorations from around the globe. Meanwhile, Gavin and Chris try to figure out which Asian country eats KFC on Christmas, which country carols with a dead horse skull, where The Elf on the Shelf originated, and more! (Hint: Regardless of your unique traditions, we wish you a very Happy Holidays!)

Sources

https://www.heifer.org/blog/weird-and-wonderful-christmas-traditions-around-the-world.html
https://www.newsweek.com/10-weird-holiday-traditions-celebrated-around-world-757732
https://spoonuniversity.com/lifestyle/8-unique-holiday-food-traditions-from-around-the-globe

entry.title: Conspiracy Theory: Paul is Dead - Season 1 Episode 25

link.title: Conspiracy Theory: Paul is Dead - Season 1 Episode 25

entry.content:
This week, Gavin gives us a deep dive into one of music’s most notorious conspiracy theories, Paul is Dead. We discuss how this theory managed to blow up and decide for ourselves if this holds any legitimacy. (Hint: Listen to decide for yourself!)

Sources

https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/paul-mccartney-is-dead-conspiracy-897189/
http://content.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1860871_1860876_1860997,00.html

author.name: Gavin Berger, Leah Ettinger, and Chris Ashe

entry.summary: This week, Gavin gives us a deep dive into one of music’s most notorious conspiracy theories, Paul is Dead. We discuss how this theory managed to blow up and decide for ourselves if this holds any legitimacy. (Hint: Listen to decide for yourself!)

entry.title: Bigfoot, Devils, and Other Cryptids - Season 1 Episode 24

link.title: Bigfoot, Devils, and Other Cryptids - Season 1 Episode 24

entry.content:
Cryptids are animals (such as Sasquatch or the Loch Ness Monster) that have been claimed to exist but never proven to exist. In our first episode about Cryptids, Chris explains the legends behind Bigfoot, The Jersey Devil, and The Dover Demon, leaving Gavin and Leah to wonder if there is some truth to these mysteries. (Hint: Listen to find out for yourself!)

Sources

https://cryptidz.fandom.com/wiki/Dover_Demon
https://weirdnj.com/stories/jersey-devil/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bigfoot

author.name: Gavin Berger, Leah Ettinger, and Chris Ashe

entry.title: Overhyped: The Last of Us Part II - Season 1 Episode 23

link.title: Overhyped: The Last of Us Part II - Season 1 Episode 23

entry.content:
This episode contains strong themes and may not be suitable for younger listeners.

For our second Overhyped episode, we talk about a more debatable overhyped video game, The Last of Us Part II. Leah brings us all the details as Chris follows along pretty well and Gavin asks a lot of clarifying questions. Plus, our friend Jeremy joins us to give us his views on the game. Also SPOILER WARNING for The Last of Us Part II. (Hint: The Last of Us Part II? More like…2 Last 2 Us.)

Sources

https://www.essentiallysports.com/the-last-of-us-part-2-breaking-down-what-players-hate-in-the-game-esports-naughty-dog-news/
https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.theverge.com/platform/amp/21286964/the-last-of-us-part-2-review-ps4
https://opencritic.com/game/8351/the-last-of-us-part-ii
https://www.npd.com/wps/portal/npd/us/news/top-10/video-games/
https://www.ign.com/articles/the-last-of-us-part-2-guide-and-walkthrough
https://www.forbes.com/sites/paultassi/2020/06/20/the-last-of-us-part-2-whats-the-problem-here-exactly/
https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2020/06/15/two-warnings-about-the-last-of-us-part-2-review-scores/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vwzNbR0_gQA
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WYNrumyho0E

entry.title: Bizarre Crowdfunding Projects - Season 1 Episode 22
entry.content:
Have you ever had a misunderstood idea? Well a lot of people have, and they’ve gotten a shocking amount of money on crowdfunding sites. This week Gavin brings some of the most bizarre crowdfunding projects while Chris and Leah debate the needs for edible cups, meat soap, and a giant inflatable sculpture of Lionel Richie’s head. (Hint: Get in on wacky crowdfunding ideas before they go viral.)

Sources

https://www.forbes.com/sites/ryanrobinson/2017/09/18/crowdfunded-side-projects-that-became-million-dollar-companies/
https://crowdfundingblog.com/most-successful-crowdfunding-projects/
https://www.lifewire.com/weirdest-successful-kickstarter-campaigns-3486133
https://www.businessnewsdaily.com/7925-weirdest-kickstarter-projects.html
https://www.visualcapitalist.com/19-weird-crowdfunding-campaigns-failed/

author.name: Gavin Berger, Leah Ettinger, and Chris Ashe

entry.title: The Pups of U.S. Presidents - Season 1 Episode 21

link.title: The Pups of U.S. Presidents - Season 1 Episode 21

entry.content:
Leah brings us one of her favorite topics to talk about… dogs! More specifically, this week we talk about the famous dogs of the U.S. Presidents, as well as a few other animals that have had the chance to live in the White House. (Hint: Red, White and…Bark? I’m sorry.)

Animal Rescue Resources

https://www.spcai.org/
https://www.aspca.org/
https://bestfriends.org/
https://www.hopeforpaws.org/
https://www.secondchanceanimals.org/

Sources

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/18/world/europe/corgi-dogs-queen-elizabeth.html
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/10/style/biden-german-shepherd-champ-major-rescue.html
https://youtu.be/1AS-dCdYZbo
https://www.bringfido.com/blog/history-of-dogs-in-the-white-house
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_corgis

entry.title: History of Superstitions - Season 1 Episode 20
entry.content:
In honor of Friday the 13th, Chris goes over the history of some famous superstitions while Leah and Gavin continue to knock on wood and throw salt over their shoulder. (Hint: Don’t break any mirrors or walk under any ladders.)

Sources

https://www.insider.com/history-origin-people-superstitions-2018-4
https://www.cracked.com/article_20594_5-shockingly-violent-back-stories-everyday-traditions.html
https://www.rd.com/list/bizarre-origins-of-everyday-superstitions/
https://www.cracked.com/pictofacts-2005-19-origins-everyday-traditions-explained/

entry.title: Bizarre Phobias - Season 1 Episode 19
entry.content:
This week, Gavin talks about some of the most bizarre and unconventional phobias, while Chris and Leah try to guess what they are. (Hint: You can guess along at home!)

Sources

https://www.therecoveryvillage.com/mental-health/phobias/related/weird-phobias/
https://emtv.com.pg/10-weirdest-phobias/

entry.title: This Spooky World: Halloween Special - Season 1 Episode 18

link.title: This Spooky World: Halloween Special - Season 1 Episode 18

entry.content:
Spooky season is upon us! And that means it’s time for This Strange World’s first spooky 3-part episode! This episode is jam-packed with spooky content galor! First, Gavin is going to talk about some of the most popular halloween candies, then Chris is going to tell us some urban legends, and finally, Leah is going to talk about some horror movies that were based on real events. So gather some candy, get dressed in your finest costume, and don’t forget to wear a mask, because it’s time for This Spooky World: Halloween Special! (Hint: Boo!)

Topics Timecodes

Gavin - Candy Facts: 05:45
Chris - Urban Legends: 46:49
Leah - Horror Movies based on Real Events: 01:19:32

Sources

https://www.thedailymeal.com/holidays/most-popular-halloween-candies-every-decade-gallery
https://www.delish.com/food-news/g23281676/most-popular-halloween-candy-year-you-were-born/
https://1029thelake.iheart.com/content/2019-10-30-most-popular-halloween-candy-state-by-state-for-2019/
https://www.eatthis.com/popular-halloween-candy-america/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/high-beams/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/the-thing/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/babysitter/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/the-peephole/
https://www.scaryforkids.com/humans-can-lick-too/
https://themorningnews.org/article/the-statue-in-the-corner
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/arent-you-glad-you-didnt-turn-on-the-light/
2 Sentence Horror Stories - Google Images
https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/movies/g19738089/horror-movies-based-on-true-stories/
https://youtu.be/qjqh9UVfNNk
https://youtu.be/1KgSp94nCZw
